intro: Mesechites brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed mesechites, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush communities. Mesechites brevipes is a perennial herb that is relatively rare and of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution.
